notes: Minor in Philosophy, Application Domain in 'Library and Information Science'
Worked on over a dozen 2-6 person teams in as many languages/technologies in the completion of project-heavy coursework, punctuated by meaningful work experience.

courses.name: Professional Communications
courses.description: Learned the pyramid method of effective and succinct communication.

courses.name: Intro to Computer Science I+II
courses.description: Covered programming fundamentals and data structures.

courses.name: Intro to Computer Science Theory
courses.description: Theoretical foundations of automata, NP completeness, and complexity.

courses.name: Introduction to Data Mining
courses.description: Learned, implemented, and applied data mining algorithms, techniques, and theory.

courses.name: Introduction to Archives
courses.description: Read, discussed, and wrote about mission, practice, and problems of maintaining digital and analog archive collections.

courses.name: Cultural Informatics
courses.description: Explored the roles, relationships, and potential of technology, metadata, collection management, and digital humanities.

courses.name: Ancient Philosophy
courses.description: Studies in early Greek philosophy, covering Plato, Aristotle, and various pre-platonists and Hellenists.

courses.name: Modern Philosophy
courses.description: Readings and discussions on Descartes, Spinoza, Berkeley, Hume, and Kant.

courses.name: Theories of Knowledge
courses.description: Readings and discussions on the nature and acquisition of knowledge and truth in the context of epistemological skepticism.

courses.name: Ethical Theory
courses.description: Exploration into the source, reach, and requirements of ethics with particular attention to Singer and Mill.

courses.name: Mathematical Models of Software Engineering
courses.description: Using modeling software to effectively predict, analyze, and manage software state, and to solve logical puzzles from lists of truths.

courses.name: Personal Software Engineering
courses.description: A primer on the pure construction of systems of software in a variety of languages by a single developer.

courses.name: Software Process and Project Management
courses.description: A deep dive into the history, practice, trends, and methodologies of organizing and executing software projects (focusing on SCRUM/Agile).

courses.name: Intro to Software Engineering
courses.description: A vital course offering a holistic picture of the joint construction of quality software, including all its phases and non-code deliverabluse.

courses.name: Engineering Software Subsystems
courses.description: An invaluable course delving deep into the theroy, practice, and vital importance of software architecture and design, heavy on patterns and philosophies.

courses.name: Intro to Web Engineering
courses.description: A project and workshop-based course explaining and demonstrating the various technologies at the core of modern web development (REST microservices, javascript frameworks, HTML5).

courses.name: Software Testing
courses.description: Training using a variety of testing strategies, modes, methods, and tools.

courses.name: Human Centered Requirements and Design
courses.description: Project-based class on eliciting, negotiating, managing, translating, and fulfilling requirements.

courses.name: Engineering Secure Software
courses.description: A primer on identifying valuable assets, understanding and investing in security as quality to protect against common vulnerabilities, and learning from famous exploits.

notes: Completed every Honors/Advanced/AP Course Offered at PIHS (17).
Was actively involved as class Vice President, and in NHS, Debate, and band, etc.
